title: US Crude Oil Inventories Take Big Hits In Storm Aftermath
summary: The American Petroleum Institute (API) estimated that crude oil inventories in the United States decreased by 11.1 million barrels in the week ending January 30. title: U.S. could issue general license for oil companies to produce in Venezuela this week, source says
summary: The oil industry's response to investing in Venezuela has been mixed, with ExxonMobil CEO Darren Woods describing the country as "uninvestable."

title: Washington Prepares Broad License to Restart Venezuelan Oil Production
summary: Washington is preparing to take another step deeper into Venezuela’s oil sector, with plans to issue a broad license that would allow companies to pump crude in the country for the first time in years. title: FBI Now Helping to Investigate “Hundreds of Leads” in Search for Savannah Guthrie’s Missing Mother
summary: On Tuesday afternoon, TMZ reported that in the morning, a ransom note had been sent to its offices seeking funds in cryptocurrency, and included an "... or else" element.

title: Siemens is Scaling Up Investment in U.S. Grid
summary: Siemens Energy on Tuesday announced it is scaling up its capabilities in the United States with a $1-billion investment in grid and gas turbine equipment to support the strong growth of the U.S. electricity market. title: Marathon Petroleum Beats Earnings Expectations as Refining Margins Surge
summary: Marathon Petroleum (NYSE: MPC) beat fourth-quarter earnings expectations by a mile as refining margins surged in the latter part of 2025.
